summary: This bill, HR 705, directs the Secretary of Defense to establish a compensation fund for military firefighters exposed to PFAS (per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances). The fund aims to provide timely compensation to current and former firefighters, and their survivors, suffering from illnesses related to PFAS exposure during their service. The bill outlines eligibility criteria, payment distribution, medical benefits, and definitions related to PFAS and military firefighters. It authorizes necessary funding for the program.
